The isotopic composition of the Po River water during the 2022-2023 drought showed distinct signatures, indicating warmer and drier conditions comparable to those in arid regions [Isotopic Evidence from the Po River Under Prolonged Drought Conditions (Northern Italy, 2022–2023)](https://www.semanticscholar.org/paper/bc1b92bd1a6a72cf3112fd32c1a396b4521df720). This study highlights the role of stable isotopes in tracing moisture sources and assessing drought impacts.

A network analysis revealed that droughts in the Po River Basin propagate through preferential pathways, with key hubs and hot-spot regions identified [Network dynamics reveal drought synchronization hubs in the Po River Basin](https://www.semanticscholar.org/paper/36187212b9913d2894916c5e9923350b93781f3f). This study advances our understanding of drought dynamics and provides a foundation for research on societal resilience to climate change.
